Continuation of #8707 .
Rebased to latest master, and changed a few places that I feel not aligned with the intended logic.

comment_regular_data.body:
I built a GUI to experiment with and try to move this feature forward: https://github.com/glacambre/nwin . I only had to perform minor changes to this PR. The few commits that I need are here: https://github.com/glacambre/neovim/commits/ext-win

I'll try to polish my GUI a bit more to see if there's anything wrong in the design, but so far so good :).
@glacambre thanks! I've force pushed your patches into this PR.

I wonder if it might make sense to allow windows to contain tabs before merging this. There are window managers that allow this, so it'd be nice to get rid of Neovim's limitations.

I don't know how feasible that is though, windows-dont-contain-tabs is probably a strong assumption in the current architecture?

@glacambre it's a matter of also delegating bufnext etc. right?
Need to figure out the right behavior for this first.
Would be great to have this!
This would be a major improvement for vscode-neovim, as currently window management is done through hacks.
Will this PR lead to being able to attach to a headless instance twice, with distinct UIs per #2161, or is this specifically requiring a GUI like @glacambre's?

I've rebased this branch onto the latest master and made some additional fixes in my fork:
  https://github.com/akiyosi/neovim/tree/ext-windows

  I've been working on this with Claude Code, and tested a build from this branch with my new GUI frontend https://github.com/akiyosi/zonvie — it's mostly working. There are still some
  rough edges to iron out, but the core ext_windows functionality is operational in a real UI client.
@akiyosi cool! if you want to open a draft PR we can close this one. ideally, keep @yatli as the author of the first (squashed commit), not including your changes.
